double_jeopardy.category: THE GEORGE H.W. BUSH PRESIDENTIAL LIBRARY

clues.category: THE GEORGE H.W. BUSH PRESIDENTIAL LIBRARY
clues.clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew reports from the Bush Library.) I'm in a mock-up of Bush's Air Force One office.  The President banned this from the menu of the presidential jet, saying he hadn't liked it since his mother made him eat it

clues.category: THE GEORGE H.W. BUSH PRESIDENTIAL LIBRARY
clues.clue: (Kelly  reports again from the Library.) As a pilot in this branch of the service, Bush was shot down near the island of Chichi Jima on Sept. 2, 1944, and rescued by the crew of the Finback

clues.category: THE GEORGE H.W. BUSH PRESIDENTIAL LIBRARY
clues.clue: (Jon of the Clue Crew reports from the Bush Library.) In the mid-1970s, George H.W. Bush served as chief U.S. liaison to this country that had just opened to the West. These bicycles were a gift from that nation

clues.category: THE GEORGE H.W. BUSH PRESIDENTIAL LIBRARY
clues.clue: (Jon reports again.) The Bush Library has a replica of the office at Camp David where on Feb. 1, 1992, President Bush & this Russian president pledged to end remnants of Cold War hostility

clues.category: THE GEORGE H.W. BUSH PRESIDENTIAL LIBRARY
